titleInfo.title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-11-16 - Part 2

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 16, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performers the Everly Brothers, Jim Reeves, Marty Robbins, and Ray Price, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 945th broadcast, the 32nd anniversary of the Opry, and that the 6th annual Disc Jockey Festival is taking place.

subject.topic: United States. Armed Forces Radio Service
